author: VNExplorer
title: Are trains and buses running today? How Storm Gerrit is affecting travel
text:
Travel disruption is expected to continue in parts of the UK on Thursday following Storm Gerrit.
The storm wreaked havoc on the travel network on Wednesday with a string of train operators – including ScotRail, LNER and Avanti West Coast – suspending and terminating some services, as well as advising customers not to travel.
Operators have advised that services could continue to be disrupted on Thursday, with ferry and road travel also at risk of delays.
Dale Hipkiss, national network manager at National Highways, has advised drivers using the roads today to drive to the conditions and leave some extra time for journeys, take extra supplies like snacks and warm clothing, make sure their phone is fully charged and to phone the emergency service if they encounter difficulties.
FirstBus, a leading UK bus operator, said customers should check its various social media accounts and the First Bus app for updated information about services.
Rail delays to continue National Rail advised that the stormy weather could continue to affect railway services on Thursday, with delays, cancellations and alterations possible.
Several ScotRail services remain affected and cannot resume until safety inspections have been completed, with limited rail replacement services in place.
Affected routes included Aberdeen to Dundee, Edinburgh to Cupar, Aberdeen to Inverness and Balloch to Bowling routes, as well as the Highland Mainline and West Highland Lines.
Heavy rain across the Transport for Wales network also means services in Wales could be impacted, with disruption on some routes possible until the end of the day on 1 January.
Train operator Avanti West Coast said a tree falling on overhead wires between Rugby and Lichfield Trent Valley meant some lines were blocked on Thursday morning.
Journey times for services from London Euston towards the North West were extended as trains were diverted via the Midlands.
It comes after the operator, which runs services on the West Coast Main Line, said its route to Scotland was impassable on Wednesday with all services to and from London terminating at Preston.
Related Article
When will Storm Gerrit end? How long will it last and latest UK weather forecast
News
When will Storm Gerrit end? How long will it last and latest UK weather forecast Read More
Those with pre-booked tickets for travel between Preston and either Edinburgh or Glasgow could board trains on Thursday or Friday, it said.
Northern, which operates rail networks in the North of England, has said that flood water on the line is potentially making the railway unsafe at Carnforth, north of Morecambe and Lancaster, meaning that services are likely to be cancelled or delayed by up to 60 minutes.
Passengers can travel on alternative TransPennine Express services to Manchester Piccadilly for connections to Lancaster.
Meanwhile, rail services at London Paddington were suspended on Thursday morning after a person was struck by a train in the Slough area, Great Western Railway (GWR) said.
Disruption is expected to continue until 11am, with GWR and Elizabeth Line services affected.
Rail networks in Scotland were forced into widespread cancellations and delays on Wednesday, suspending multiple train services until further notice.
One train driver’s cabin was hit by a falling tree, with Aslef Scotland confirming the driver was uninjured and Labour MSP Paul Sweeney adding that passengers were also unharmed.
Train operator LNER – which runs services between London and Scotland on the East Coast Main Line – also advised passengers not to travel due to the weather, with customers stranded by the disruption told to book hotels which they can claim back.
High winds can block railway tracks and damage power lines with felled trees and other debris, as well as forcing trains to run at slower speeds than usual to operate safely.
Heavy rainfall can cause flooding on tracks, affecting train transfer points and electrical systems.
Rail journeys can be checked using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner, while the latest status and disruption updates can be found on the National Rail website.
On Wednesday, 18 flights were cancelled at Heathrow airport due to air traffic control restrictions, including routes from Aberdeen, Edinburgh, Glasgow, Jersey and Manchester as well as to Barcelona, Berlin, Madrid and Paris.
No further cancellations were announced by the airport as of Thursday morning.
Ferry operator Red Funnel, which provides services between Southampton and Cowes on the Isle of Wight, cancelled its Red Jet passenger services on Wednesday due to strong winds.
Another operator, DFDS, said on Thursday that its sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the Channel.
Passengers are being advised to check in as normal and are being put onto the first available sailing.
Scotland Police have confirmed the A9 has reopened in both directions and is “passable with care” after snow blocked the road between Drumochter and Dalwhinnie, leaving some drivers trapped for hours.
The force’s Road Policing Unit warning that conditions may remain hazardous, and that extra caution should be exercised.
The A90 northbound has also reopened after earlier closures, but southbound lanes at Lochlands in Forfar remain off-limits with local diversions in place.
Some roads around Scotland remained shut on Thursday morning, including the A82 between Invergarry and Fort Augustus in the Highlands and the A96 at Huntly, Aberdeenshire.
Stein Connelly, head of transport resilience at Transport Scotland, urged people to plan ahead when travelling.
He said: “It’s been an extremely challenging period for the transport network. The partnership response to Storm Gerrit continues and our trunk road operating companies are working hard to open roads as soon as possible.”

author: dgallo
title: ¿De qué murió Manuel Elkin Patarroyo? El científico lleva varios días con quebrantos de salud
text:
[Daniela
Gallo
](/autores/daniela-gallo)
¿De qué murió Manuel Elkin Patarroyo? El científico llevaba varios días con quebrantos de salud
El investigador fue reconocido por presentar la vacuna contra la malaria. Su hijo entregó los primeros detalles de su deceso.
El jueves 9 de enero, la Universidad Nacional de Colombia confirmó la muerte del investigador y científico colombiano Manuel Elkin Patarroyo a los 78 años de edad, quien se desempeñó como docente de esa institución educativa. La noticia fue inicialmente compartida por la decana de la Facultad de Ciencias, Gabriela Delgado.
A través de su cuenta de X, la también docente escribió: "Hoy, ha partido un gran científico colombiano: Manuel Elkin Patarroyo. Su legado está representado, más que en la primera vacuna sintética del mundo, en una generación de investigadores a quienes inculcó el valor de construir país, generando conocimiento. ¡Gracias!".
Le puede interesar: ¿Quién era Manuel Elkin Patarroyo y por qué su nombre generó polémica en Colombia?
Nacido el 3 de noviembre de 1946 en Ataco (Tolima), Colombia, el científico tomó relevancia en la década de 1980 cuando presentó la primera dosis sintética contra la malaria, conocida como SPf66. La enfermedad es una de las más combatidas en países del trópico, pues es una de las que más muertes genera.
Este inmunizante marcó un hito en la batalla contra la malaria cuando fue desarrollado. Sin embargo, con el tiempo, surgieron cuestionamientos sobre su eficacia. Incluso la Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS), tras realizar múltiples análisis y evaluaciones, afirmó en su momento que la vacuna no alcanzaba los estándares esperados de efectividad.
Hijo de Manuel Elkin Patarroyo confirmó la causa de su muerte
En un comunicado oficial, la Universidad Nacional resaltó y agradeció su aporte a la ciencia y la salud en Colombia y envió condolencias a su familia. "En su larga trayectoria docente e investigativa obtuvo múltiples reconocimientos y distinciones entre los que se destacan el Premio Príncipe de Asturias de Investigación Científica y Técnica y el doctorado Honoris Causa de la Universidad Nacional (...) Extendemos nuestras más sentidas condolencias", expresaron.
Aunque la universidad no precisó la causa del fallecimiento del científico colombiano, horas después, su hijo Manuel Patarroyo compartió los primeros detalles de su deceso. En diálogo con la revista Semana, indicó que su padre llevaba varios días presentando quebrantos de salud.
Le puede interesar: Venezolanos en Colombia respaldan a la oposición y aseguraron que irán "hasta el final"
De acuerdo con Patarrayo, la salud de su padre continuó deteriorándose hasta que falleció en horas de la mañana del jueves 9 de enero a causa de un paro cardiorrespiratorio. El diario El Tiempo además conoció que el deceso del investigador se habría dado en su casa, en la ciudad de Bogotá.
El doctor Carlos Francisco Fernández, amigo personal de Patarroyo, se pronunció sobre la muerte del científico y, en una nota compartida al mismo diario, envió un sentido mensaje destacando sus aportes a la investigación en Colombia.
"Despedimos al doctor Manuel Elkin Patarroyo, un grande de la ciencia y el padre de las vacunas sintéticas, cuyo legado en la lucha contra las enfermedades infecciosas ayudó a transformar la investigación en el país. Su incansable trabajo, su compromiso con la salud pública y su valentía para enfrentar críticas y desafíos dejan una huella imborrable en los campos académicos y sanitarios que lo reconocen a nivel internacional", expresó el doctor Fernández al rotativo bogotano.
Le puede interesar: Pilas conductores: cambia el trámite para la revisión técnico-mecánica para este 2025
Y renglón seguido agregó: "No solo fue un pionero en la inmunología, sino también un ejemplo de entrega y pasión por el conocimiento. Su partida nos deja un vacío, pero su legado seguirá inspirando a quienes creen que la ciencia es el camino hacia un mundo mejor".

author: Sarwat Nasir
title: Abu Dhabi company secures Dh2.55bn to build new satellites
text:
Space42, the Abu Dhabi-based artificial intelligence-powered SpaceTech company, has secured Dh2.55 billion ($695.5 million) in funding to develop two next-generation communication satellites.
The satellites Al Yah 4 and Al Yah 5 will help provide faster and more secure communications across the Middle East, Africa, Europe and Asia.
Expected to launch in 2027 and 2028, they will eventually take over from the UAE’s Al Yah 1 and 2 satellites, launched more than a decade ago.
Announced on Tuesday, the funding was secured by leading international banks and supported by the Bpifrance Assurance Export, a financing agency.
“These new satellites are part of a long-term programme that will support vital communication needs in both the defence and civil sectors,” said Andrew Cole, chief financial officer at Space42.
“This funding gives us the flexibility we need to keep growing and meeting the needs of our customers.”
Space42, which trades on the Abu Dhabi Securities Exchange (ADX), was awarded a 17-year Dh18.7 billion contract by the UAE government last year to help speed up the construction of its new satellites.
Included was the Dh3.7 billion in advanced payments for the development of the Al Yah 4 and Al Yah 5 satellites.
Space42 was formed last year when UAE satellite company Yahsat merged with AI and mapping firm Bayanat.

author: Miguel, Salazar
title: Las cámaras térmicas registran temperaturas por encima de los 65ºC en algunos puntos de Madrid
text:
Calor Extremo
Las cámaras térmicas registran temperaturas por encima de los 65ºC en algunos puntos de Madrid
Greenpeace denuncia la falta de zonas verdes en la capital, que ayudarían a combatir el calor extremo.
Publicidad
Las temperaturas que han registrado unas cámaras térmicas por la ciudad de Madrid parecen más propias de un sitio extremadamente cálido como Nueva Delhi, Abu Dabi o Riad. Tal y como explican desde Greenpeace, que ha realizado este ensayo para denunciar la necesidad de incluir más
zonas verdes en las ciudades, en la capital se han notado valores que superan hasta los 60 grados durante las últimas horas.
Por ejemplo, con el dispositivo han podido comprobar que en la Plaza Mayor se han llegado a alcanzar hasta los 63,5ºC. En la emblemática Puerta del Sol se registraron 54,8ºC y en la plaza de Callao la cámara térmica recogió valores que no bajaron de los 65ºC. Un grupo de integrantes de la organización ecologista hizo este experimento en áreas donde apenas hay vegetación, que en esta época del año se vuelven difícilmente transitables a causa del
calor extremo. Compararon tales registros con zonas verdes o sombreadas para demostrar una vez más que la vegetación se convierte en el remedio esencial para proteger a la población y hacer accesibles las ciudades a las altas temperaturas.
Por ejemplo, cerca del Museo del Prado se notaron valores que rondaban los 45ºC. En cambio, cuando las cámaras térmicas se desplazaron hacia la arboleda que hay en el Paseo del Prado, las temperaturas eran mucho más frescas, de unos 27ºC por las fuentes y la vegetación.
Los aparatos que registraron para denunciar la falta de zonas verdes se emplean para ofrecer imágenes térmicas de los objetos, sin necesidad de que haya contacto, mediante las emisiones de radiación infrarroja.
En las áreas donde no había árboles la temperatura superaba los 53ºC, mientras que en las quesí existía vegetación se notaban entre 15ºC y 20ºC menos. En la Plaza de Santa Ana, Greenpeace denuncia que la construcción de un parking impulsada por el Ayuntamiento de Madrid amenaza cerca del 85% de sus árboles. Denuncian que no se trata de ninguna medida positiva para combatir con el cambio climático.
771 muertes en julio por el calor extremo
El Instituto de Salud Carlos III ha arrojado datos preocupantes sobre las muertes a causa del calor extremo. En el mes de julio hubo 771 fallecimientos por los golpes de calor, lo que ha supuesto 85 más con respecto al año pasado. La estadística se anuncia en un momento en el que el país atraviesa la tercera ola de calor de este verano, que ha batido récords de temperatura en España.
Tal y como explican desde la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología, se han registrado valores históricos en ciudades como Barcelona, Zaragoza o Bilbao, entre otras. En la Ciudad Condal se alcanzaron los 40ºC, mientras que en las otras dos se experimentaron mínimas nocturnas altas muy poco frecuentes, que se encontraban entre los 28,1ºC y los 21,7ºC.
Ramón Corell, médico de playas de Cruz Roja Valencia, ha explicado que el cambio climático es ya una amenaza real para la salud de las personas. Asegura que los síntomas principales de un golpe de calor suelen ser "dolor de cabeza, mareo, confusión, piel seca y caliente, náuseas e incluso, en casos severos, pérdida de conciencia".

author: Hindustan Times
title: Ground News - Israel's Port Cities Under Fire From Lebanon; Hezbollah Strikes With Drones, Missiles
text:
Summary by Hindustan Times Hezbollah militants attacked Israeli cities of Acre and Haifa with drones and missiles, media reports from Israel said. The drones and missiles were however shot down by the Israel's air defence systems and there was no report of casualty anywhere in the strikes. This as clashes continue between Israel and Hezbollah on Lebanon-Israeli border amid Gaza war. Share menu More

author: Alessio Pediglieri
title: Giovane lottatore si rompe il collo in combattimento, è in condizioni disperate: "Incidente terrificante"
text:
Giovane lottatore si rompe il collo in combattimento, è in condizioni disperate: “Incidente terrificante”
Alessio Pediglieri
Lui si chiama Dominic Haines e ha solamente 17 anni. E' uno studente di Atlanta e un lottatore dilettante che ha delle grandi potenzialità. O meglio, aveva. Perché durante un combattimento, ha avuto un infortunio impressionante, in cui si è rotto quasi la totalità dei muscoli del collo "ritrovandosi senza sensibilità dalle spalle in giù", hanno spiegato poi i medici. Che hanno definito l'incidente "terrificante e assurdo. Capita una volta su un milione". Haines ora si dovrà sottoporre ad un secondo intervento chirurgico dopo il primo in cui gli hanno impiantato una gabbia spinale per sostenerlo: adesso verrà operato direttamente alle vertebre.
" Se ciò che ti uccide ti rende più forte, allora quando Dominic tornerà non ce ne sarà per nessuno, diventerà una macchina". Sono le parole di papà Zach dopo che il figlio appena diciassettenne si era gravemente infortunato ai Georgia High School Association State Championships. Forse Dominic non ritornerà mai più sul ring, ma poco conta: sta combattendo la battaglia più difficile della sua giovane vita, dopo un incidente assurdo. A seguito di un colpo Dominic ha perso la sensibilità dalle spalle in giù, rompendosi quasi tutti i muscoli del collo. Costretto all'immediato ricovero in ospedale si è sottoposto ad un primo intervento chirurgico, in cui gli hanno impiantato una "gabbia attorno al midollo spinale, per aiutarlo a sostenere il peso del corpo". Da quel momento, per Dominic e la sua famiglia è iniziato l'incubo: lunghissime sedute di fisioterapia con il ragazzo incapace di muovere inizialmente un solo muscolo. Poi i primi progressi: "Ho sentito alcuni muscoli delle gambe e dei glutei rispondere" ha spiegato il fisioterapista che l'ha in cura.
Per Dominic però la strada verso il recupero è lunghissima. Dopo i progressi, ha accusato altri problemi gravi, nella deglutizione, a tal punto che è stato sottoposto ad un nuovo delicatissimo intervento, prima di quello che dovrà subire, direttamente sulle vertebre: "Gli hanno fatto delle radiografie di controllo" racconta il padre. "Hanno scoperto che le cose non vanno come dovrebbero mentre deglutisce: non può più mangiare cibi solidi, solo budini, gelatine e succhi. Gli hanno inserito un sondino gastrico con cui nutrirlo: per ogni passo in avanti che fa ne sta facendo due indietro".
Tuttavia, la battaglia continua e Dominic è in prima fila grazie all'impegno del padre: "Ho letto a Dominic un sacco di risposte ai miei post e gli piace sentirle" ha raccontato ancora il padre che aggiorna quotidianamente sulle condizioni del figlio per il quale è stata aperta anche una donazione in cui sono stati riversati migliaia di euro per sostenere le cure mediche. "Ha detto ‘Papà, non sapevo che così tante persone si preoccupassero per me. Puoi leggerne un altro paio, per favore?". Ora il nuovo intervento: "Gli resterà una cicatrice dai 7 ai 10 centimetri, dovrà ancora soffrire molto ma ha capito che è l'unica via verso il ritorno alla normalità anche se c'è il serio rischio che perderà definitivamente almeno il 25% del movimento del collo".

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Local woman tackles the world of sports as game day host for Packers, Admirals
text: Traits of the perfect job may include teamwork, excitement, and a desire to win. For Deysha Smith-Jenkins, those come with not one but all FOUR of her jobs. For the past two years, she's served as one of the game-day hosts for the legendary Green Bay Packers. TMJ4's Andrea Williams met with her in Green Bay. "We are here at the historic Lambeau Field, what's it like for you to have a job in this stadium?" Williams asked. "It's unreal, the Packers are so historic, so I still can't believe that I have this gig," said Deysha. As if spending your Sundays in the Frozen Tundra isn't "cool" enough. Deysha also serves as the game-day host for the Milwaukee Admirals. How did she land THIS gig? "The power of social media, so I've done a couple of NBA opportunities. I posted a couple of things on the red carpet, and I literally had a Director of Entertainment DM me on Instagram. It doesn't even feel like work!" said Deysha. It's been said, when you're doing what you love you never have to work a day in your life. Being a huge sports fan and former athlete she truly understands what that feels like. "Well, I have a saying, they say, once an athlete, always an athlete!" The former Whitefish Bay Dominican High School basketball standout and three-time track and field state champion also finds time to be an assistant coach at her alma mater. "What's it like for you to walk these halls and be a conditioning coach for the girls' basketball team?" Williams asked. "Well first of all the hallways still smell the exact same. Not a lot has changed, maybe the staff, but it's a full circle moment to be able to coach alongside my coach, (and) my dad...it's a treat," said Deysha. Full circle for sure...Not only does she coach alongside her dad, Derick Jenkins, but she also coaches alongside Dominican Girls Basketball Head Coach Kevin Schramka who coached her when she was a student. "We never had to worry about teams pressing us, she was really a one-man team, she could do it all! She could play all five positions, and she was in all my years of coaching, she was one my best defenders I ever had," said Schramka. Deysha affectionately known as Coach D., also has a special relationship with the young ladies that she coaches. "Coach D looks out for us like our mom on the court. She's always making sure we're ok mentally, physically," said Kaylei Agee. She's known Laylah Rose Bly since she was in the third grade and has been an inspiration to her as well. "She's really an inspirational woman leader role for us, like if we didn't have her, I don't think the team would be where it is right now," said Bly. After graduating from Dominican, Deysha was recruited by the University of Connecticut for track and field. Her UConn uniform now sits in this case at Dominican right under her uncle Shannon's jersey. "And so that's why I was so excited to come back eight years ago and coach because I'm like I got everything I wanted out of 4 years and then I was able to spend another 4 years in and I was so fortunate that they let me come back to pour in the future," said Deysha. When she's not at Lambeau, Panther Arena, or her old high school, you can find Deysha using the 25th hour (also the name of her business) as a photographer and videographer. "At the end of the day, I want to go to bed exhausted, because when I woke up, I spent all 24 hours and however many hours during that day, doing what I love and that's what it's all about!" It’s about time to watch on your time. Stream local news and weather 24/7 by searching for “TMJ4” on your device. Available for download on Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and more.
